name: CreateCustomerReturn
description:
Create a return order from an existing sales order (`OrderID`).

When a `TargetOrderID` has been specified, newly created lines are added to that specific order. When omitted, the lines are either added to the
existing, original order (in case that is still permitted) or a new order is created automatically.

Returns information on the (newly created?) return order.
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Customer` or `Api` with functionality `ReturnOrder:None`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-BackendSystemID
headers.description: The ID of the backend system that is used to resolve the IDs.

request_samples.name: CURL
request_samples.sample:
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "EVA-User-Agent: MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  --data '{
  "AmountToRefund": 123.456,
  "BackendID": "string",
  "BackendSystemID": "string",
  "CreateInOriginalOrganizationUnit": true,
  "Lines": [
    {
      "CustomFields": {
        "key": {
          "ArrayValues": [
            {
              "re": "cursion"
            }
          ],
          "BlobValue": "66fb84f4-4e59-4461-a7eb-c4ee509f95ad",
          "BoolValue": true,
          "DateTimeValue": "2024-07-05",
          "NumberValue": 123.456,
          "StringValue": "string"
        }
      },
      "OrderLineID": 123,
      "Quantity": 123,
      "RefundCorrectionReasonID": 123,
      "Remark": "string",
      "ReturnReasonID": 123,
      "StockLabelID": 123,
      "UnitAmountToRefund": 123.456
    }
  ],
  "OrderID": 123,
  "RefundCorrectionReasonID": 123,
  "ReturnWithoutProducts": true,
  "SecurityCode": "string",
  "StockOrganizationUnitID": 123,
  "TargetOrderID": 123
}' \
  https://euw.acme.test.eva-online.cloud/message/CreateCustomerReturn

D.name: DateTimeValue
D.description: Used for datatype DateTime and Date

D.name: NumberValue
D.description: Used for datatype Integer and Decimal

D.name: StringValue
D.description: Used for datatype String, Text and Enum

C.name: CustomFields
C.description: The custom fields to store on the orderline. The key of the dictionary should be the name of the custom field.

C.name: OrderLineID
C.description: This is the ID of a `OrderLine`

C.name: RefundCorrectionReasonID
C.description:
When not the whole amount is refunded, a reason for this correction can be set. This will only have an affect if `UnitAmountToRefund` is lower than the total amount of this return line.

This is the ID of a `RefundCorrectionReason`

C.name: ReturnReasonID
C.description: This is the ID of a `ReturnReason`

C.name: StockLabelID
C.description: Return it to the given stocklabel. This is only available for employees.

C.name: UnitAmountToRefund
C.description: When a ReturnWithoutProducts is done, but not the full amount should be refunded, a different amount can be provided - cannot exceed the worth of the returned products

B.name: AmountToRefund
B.description: When a ReturnWithoutProducts is done, but not the full amount should be refunded, a different amount can be provided - cannot exceed the worth of the returned products

B.name: BackendID
B.description: Optional, attached to a possible newly created (return) order - requires `BackendSystemID`

B.name: BackendSystemID
B.description: Optional, attached to a possible newly created (return) order - requires `BackendID`

B.name: CreateInOriginalOrganizationUnit
B.description: Attach the order to the same OrganizationUnit as the returned order

B.name: OrderID
B.description: This is the ID of a `Order`

B.name: RefundCorrectionReasonID
B.description:
When not the whole amount is refunded, a reason for this correction can be set. This will only have an affect if `AmountToRefund` is lower than the total amount of this return.

This is the ID of a `RefundCorrectionReason`

B.name: ReturnWithoutProducts
B.description: The products will not be returned, so the return order will be shipped immediately and the stock will be corrected

B.name: SecurityCode
B.description: User is allowed to create return order when a valid security code is provided. The user has to have the ReturnWithoutSecurityCode role when omitted. `CRM:Return:RequiresOrderSecurityCode` needs to be enabled.

B.name: StockOrganizationUnitID
B.description:
When the stock should be returned to a specific OrganizationUnit (see `GetReturnableStatusForOrder.StockOrganizationUnits`)

This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnit`

B.name: TargetOrderID
B.description: This is the ID of a `Order`

F.name: Code
F.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

F.name: Message
F.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

F.name: RequestID
F.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

F.name: Type
F.description: A short description of the error type.

G.name: ExternalIDs
G.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

G.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
G.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

G.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
G.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
